Sep 11 2008 	Great Location and Staff	We (me and wife) stayed at the Fremont for the weekend of Aug 8-10 before moving to the Stratosphere (see my other review) for Aug 10-15. We were visiting Vegas for our 21st anniversary. The price at the Fremont was half the Stratosphere for the weekend at $54 per night (Fri and Sat night). The room was super clean - a little on the small side - but did have a full King Size bed and full bath - not much else fits in the room. But you know what - it was great for the few hours we actually spent in the room.The staff at this hotel / casino are great from the Valet to front desk to cocktail waitresses and dealers - all super customer service. The check in at the hotel from car drop off at valet to our room took a whole 5 minutes and our check out was even quicker!! The drink service in the casino was better then any other casino we vistted this week (and we went to a lot!)We had champagne brunch both Saturday and Sunday in the buffet - very nice buffet - one of the better ones we ate at. With 2 for 1 from hotel checkin the first day and comped 2 for 1 the second day we had champagne brunch with tip for less then $20 for the two of us.Great $3 blackjack and video poker selection. Nice enough casino with a Dunkin Donuts in the middle for morning coffee.But the best part of this hotel is its location - from our room to the middle of Fremont Street with access to Four Queens, Golden Nugget etc. took less than 3 minutes. Down the hall, down the elevator, short walk through casino and you are outside.Anyways I think you get the idea - this place is great - we wanted to stay downtown for the weekend and experience Fremont Street without having to drive back to the strip at night - and we got a great treat. We may even stay here for the whole week on our next visit.

Jul 9 2008 	Great cheap stay	OK, I was looking for a cheap hotel to stay in advance of my travelling companion turning up to share on the hotel costs. I was also conscious that I needed this cheap stay over the weekend when Vegas is at its most expensive. The idea of staying downtown then was a brainwave to cover the weekend and then I moved to the Strip for fantastic midweek rates by which time my friend had appeared.The Fremont was the perfect base for downtown. It was 30 / $60 for a Friday and a Sat in June and was just fantastic for the price. The place was clean and safe and right on Fremont St so you could nip down for the hourly light shows of an evening. The room was clean and tastefully if economically decorated. There was one Queen bed as there would not have been room for two beds and the room would have been fine for a couple - and was certainly roomy enough for one. The bathroom was small but roomy enough for two I would have thought - especially if one of you was in the shower! Btw, it was shower only, no bath. The room was spotless. Ice down the end of the hall. Safe in the room. I really couldn't fault the hotel. A brilliant bargain and I would recommend it whole-heartedly. Staff were very friendly.

Jul 4 2008 	One quick night	I needed 1 night (a Friday) and booked with my Credit Card points so it was a free stay. Very easy to arrive, they only have free valet parking so that was a snap. Check in at 5pm was also a breeze.Room was very clean and bed was very comfortable. The safe had a missing key, called the desk and someone was there in 10 minutes. When he couldn't get the lock changed I went down and they gave me a new room. All staff that we interacted with were very nice. I do not have one complaint. Ate at the Buffet for brunch on Saturday with a 2 for 1 deal, the selection and quality were outstanding.Will stay again.

Jun 20 2008 	Great as always	Stayed one night at the Fremont on Friday June 13. Since I was staying by myself, my room was small and had one double bed. Clean and comfortable. The one thing I noticed, I had to reserve a smoking room for booking late. Did not think to try and change it upon check in. The room itself did not smell like smoke but my pillows did. Was tired and didn't do anything about it.I really like how you don't have to walk far from the elevators to your room. I don't really like to gamble in the casino here, it's fairly small. I don't care for the food at the Fremont. The buffet is just ok and the food at the Lanai Express is awful (chinese food and shrimp cocktail). However, my sister likes the food at Lanai Express. Golden Gates has a great shrimp cocktail. Good prime rib at the 4 Queens and Binions. Also had a donut about 12:30 in the morning at Dunkin Donuts, it wasn't very fresh. I still love the rooms here and the rates are great. There are other casinos and food close by.

Jun 14 2008 	Great Place to Stay	My wife and I stayed at the Fremont from June 1-6, 2008. Felt comfortable booking here because of the the reviews we read. The hotel was just as we expected, nothing fancy but comfortable and clean.Checked in around 2pm and the process took less than a minute. Very friendly check in, almost scary that this could take such short time. Felt like everyone knew us like neighbors.Our room did not have a safe (was removed for some reason) so they moved us to another room on the same floor immediately after maintenance came and looked at the room.Bathroom is small but clean and no problem for us. It might be a problem if there were four people trying to get ready for a dressier event at the same time but we just gambled the whole trip. Everything else in the room was just fine. True, there are not many TV channels but there was local news, ESPN, national news, and weather channel.The location is close to everything. Played a lot at Golden Gate because they had $3 blackjack and always openings at the $5 tables. The California was good because the had the Let It Ride table open in the morning. The 99 cent shrimp cocktail at the Golden Gate is great and David Sommers playing the piano at the bar was super. The pickup and drop off for the duece (bus to the strip) was very close. We did not like the gambling at the Fremont because the Let it Ride did not open until about 8pm, we couldn't get on a blackjack table in the evening, and the blackjack table (dealing out of a shoe) was not open in the morning.We ate breakfast at the Fremont every morning and liked the buffet. Can not complain about the price. Two evening meals at the 4 queens was also very good. One evening meal at the California was not very good.Will definately stay here on our future trips. We go to Vegas about once a year or every 9 months. Have stayed on the strip before but found ourselves downtown the whole time.

May 28 2008	Best Cafe for eating downtown - period	Did not stay at this Casino - but it has the best Cafe for eating downtown. We stayed downtown 5 night and tried lots of places to eat and the Fremont Casino Cafe had the best food. We ate there 4 times.

May 24 2008 	Great Downtown Property	I spent two nights at the Fremont Hotel in May. I decided to stop in Vegas on the way home to NY from LA and wanted to stay Downtown. I usually stay at the Golden Nugget, but I found the Fremont to be considerably cheaper for those two nights and decided to give it a try to experience something different. Really glad I made the choice! The Fremont Hotel was a very nice, comfortable, clean hotel right in the middle of Fremont Street. I would definitely consider the Fremont Hotel for future visits (as well as The GN).The check-in process cant be beat. Not one person in line when I arrived. I walked to the front desk (which was about 10 feet from the valet area), gave them my credit card and ID and had my keys in under a minute. Received the King Non-Smoking room I reserved without any problems. Elevators to the rooms were directly behind the front desk (about 5 steps). No long walks through the casino or past crowds. Everything was so easy. The room was very comfortable and clean. The rooms had a nice, modern dcor, not the old floral bedspreads and heavy curtains of some downtown properties. The bed and linens were especially comfortable. There was a single armchair and small side table, a dressing bench near the closet and a two drawer dresser which also included the TV. The closet included an iron and safe. Yes, the room was small but it was fine for me as a solo traveler and would be sufficient for a couple. The bathroom was very clean and well-laid out to maximize space. There were two counters that ran the length of the sink/toilet to provide for additional storage. The shower had good pressure. The curtain rod was bowed, providing a bit extra shoulder room in the shower. The towels were of nice quality and were very new (they even shed a bit due to lack of washes I believe). Soap, shampoo, conditioner and hair cap provided. There is also a hair dryer in the bathroom.As for room negatives, there were a few. I didnt like the look of the armchair in the room  its white so it showed a lot of stains. The TV was pretty small and the channel selection was very limited (I think there are 10 channels  two of which are hotel info stations). One of the window shutters didnt work properly so it limited light in the room. The room safe is key-locked, not code accessed, so one more thing to carry around and worry about losing. Thats about it though. Everything else more than met my expectations. The front desk staff, bars/buffet staff and housekeeping were all very friendly and helpful. Casino table personnel were less friendly, with special criticism of the craps dealers, who were particularly rude to several older customers. They yelled at one older woman repeatedly to toss her chips to the middle for hard-ways bets when it was very clear she had some mobility issues and struggled to toss the chips even a short distance. I guess I thought the dealers job was to assist the players! Much better crews (and odds) at Binions if youre a craps player.Ate at the buffet one morning and it was good value for the quality of the food provided but certainly not gourmet dining. The bar in the middle of the casino consistently had some of the best bartenders: friendly, engaging, quick to get a refill, etc. I also liked the addition of a Dunkin Donuts in the property for early morning pick-me-ups.Overall, I had a great stay at the Fremont. If youre looking for a comfortable, clean hotel in the middle of the Fremont Street action, I strongly recommend the Fremont Hotel. It will definitely be on my list the next time Im in LV.

May 14 2008 	Comfortable hotel in Old Las Vegas	This was at least my 6th stay at the Fremont in the past ten or so years. I joined other family members there as we celebrated a landmark birthday for my Mother. I like staying downtown in "Old" Las Vegas--everything you need is right there and there are plenty of cheap shuttles or buses if you wish to go to the Strip or to the Mall or anywhere else. As other reviewers have said, the rooms at the Fremont are reasonably priced and adequate. I do not need a fancy hotel, but I like cleanliness and comfort. My bed and pillow were very comfortable and the sheets were crisp and clean; the lady from housekeeping, Katie, was very pleasant and accommodating and asked every day if we wanted our sheets changed. In my Mother's room there was a problem with the water not draining out of the tub, and we reported this; the plumber came right up and discovered the same problem in our neighbor's tub and snaked out the drain. . . I really did not want to know about all this. The bathrooms are small, reminding me of bathrooms in Italian hotels. The water in the shower is marvelously hot and the pressure, great. I loved the view in my room of the Sierra Nevadas and the nearby hotels. Unfortunately, the windows do not open, at all, so you can't get a breath of fresh air. There is an air conditioner/heating unit in the room which makes for some kind of air circulation; despite this, and despite the fact that we were on a no smoking floor, secondhand smoke drifted up through the elevator shaft, I guess, and sometimes came into my room under the door. I rolled up a towel and put it against the space under the door when I went to bed at night. There is also a considerable amount of cigarette smoke in the casino on the lower level which you have to walk through to get to your room. There was a small keyed safe in the room, an ironing board and iron, a hair dryer, plenty of towels, cups, ice bucket, and a TV. The usual pad of hotel paper was missing, there were just a few little pieces of white paper and a pen. Plenty of hangers. An upholstered chair and little table and also suitcase stands. The Fremont provided my Mother with some coupons for discounts in the hotel's restaurants; although they looked nice, the coupons weren't all that much of a bargain. We ate at the Paradise Buffet on a Friday night when it was seafood night, and it was a real disappointment. I guess, being a New Englander, I should know to avoid seafood out West, but this used to be a really nice buffet. I think the restaurant has been cutting corners to save money as the quality was not that high--iceberg lettuce on the salad bar and few interesting raw veggies for the salad; manufactured rolls and desserts; breaded shrimp that looked like Mrs. Paul's, etc. The restaurant space was gorgeous, but the hotel should be more careful because the quality is slipping. I liked the new Dunkin Donuts tucked away in a corner of the casino--nice for an inexpensive coffee and bagel. And we always love the 99 cent margaritas!I am not a wild gambler, but I play the slots a little. I have had one of the casino's "Gold Cards" that you put in the machine to tot up your credits. In all my visits through the years, I have never been able to use my credits for anything because the Fremont says you need to first reach 5,000 credits before you can cash them in for a meal, etc. Well, this is a ridiculous policy. I use my other little card at Binion's Horseshoe across the street and you can redeem your credits, no matter how few they are, towards a meal any time you wish; you don't even have to get a "comp coupon" ahead of time. In general, I would say that everything cost more in all the casinos and restaurants during this visit to Vegas; seems everyone has raised their prices to accommodate the current economy in the U.S. I guess. Even the slots were miserably tight, although I did see a few folks around me hitting four of a kind once in awhile. But no big ones!

May 12 2008 	It is what it is	I booked the hotel based on the recommendations from other travelers in this site. I got what I expected. The review before mine indicated the hotel had no ice bucket or ice machine but at least on the 7th floor where I stayed there was one next to the stairs. Also Im 5'11'' and had plenty of room while sitting in the toilet. The rooms seemed to be newly remodeled and clean. Like old Vegas hotel/casinos the rooms at the Fremont were designed as a place to crash between gambling binges and not a room to hang out or conduct business. The TV had CNN (plus 9 other channels) and pay per view movies and I thought it was sufficient. This is the first time I stayed Downtown and I think Im coming back. If you want to visit other casinos within walking distance and cheap prices on booze and food the Fremont is the place.

May 7 2008	A basic hotel with no extras	This is a basic hotel. If you want extras, you won't get it here. The room was clean, average size, but missing alot of amenities that you might not even think about until you need them. It did not have a desk, any internet service in the room, or ice bucket because the hotel has no ice available. The hotel has no fitness center and no business center. The bathroom was a little cramped. There's something about knocking your knees on the door while sitting on the toilet. The TV was small and only had very basic channels. I guess they want you down in the casino gambling, not up in your room watching TV. It is fine if you are just sleeping in it, which most people coming to Las Vegas are doing. But I'm here on business and it's a little difficult without a few of the business related amenities. I was also disappointed to see that there was not an extra security lock on the door. As a single person traveling, I appreciate the extra security lock, and notice when it's not there. The price was definitely good. It's in the old section of town, on Fremont Street, but there is easy access by bus to the newer section of town if you want to wander.

May 4 2008 	Great downtown experience	I've stayed in several downtown Vegas hotels but this was the first time I booked a room at the Fremont. I was pleasantly surprised; yes the room is small and bathroom even smaller, but the room was clean and bed was comfortable. The hotel employees were friendly and our requests were taken care of promptly. Check in was the fastest I've ever experienced and I never had to wait for an elevator. I didn't care much for the food but they did have a good coffee spot. The only negative thing I can say about the Fremont is their lack of room darkening drapes. They have plantation shutters>>>come on this is Vegas. After pulling an all nighter the last thing I wanted to see was the sun in my eyes. I like to stay up most of (or all) the night and sleep late when I visit Las Vegas. I wish the Fremont would change their window coverings. But that's just my own personal gripe. Overall I had a fantastic time at the Fremont.

May 3 2008 	Explaining mixed Reviews	For those who pay for their own travel and want a clean, safe, reasonable hotel room than this is a good bet. My wife and I stayed in the Luxor for two nights, went to the Grand Canyon for some hiking and then needed a place to stay before an early morning flight. The first room we were given was right next to the Fremont experience light and sound show side of the hotel. The room was a suite, fairly large, had a fridge, and had not been remodeled in awhile. We asked for another room since I was concerned about the noise from the light and sound show (The front desk said that the light show was over at midnight so there should not be a problem still gave us a new room).The next room we were given was on the other side on the hotel was next to the banquet hall on the second floor. The was a banquet going on until 10:00pm but not really a problem. Second room had been redone within the last 2-4 years and was nicer than the first room - no fridge. If you are expecting the Luxor or updated hotel on the strip you will not get it. Paid $80 for the Luxor room during the week and was told the same room would be $200 for a Friday or Saturday night. Paid $80 for the Fremont room on a Saturday night. One reason for not giving it a "5" is that there are not many food options around the hotel.

Apr 16 2008 	Humble but a great value	I'd simply say 'ditto' to the other reviews here, but that wouldn't help much. But since I won't be covering new ground, I'll try to keep it brief; read more reviews for more details.It started with a great rate when I booked my room from the hotel web site. A week later, the rate had dropped, and when I emailed, they matched the new rate. By the time I checked in, the rate was up again, but I still paid the lower price I had locked in.Check-in was friendly, painless and fast. The elevators were across from the front desk; no extra walks on narrow paths between slot machines. The room was small but adequate; so was the bathroom. It was all clean, and the bed was soft and comfortable. Adjustable wooden shutters filtered most of the morning light from the window. The old-fashioned air conditioner cooled the room just right when running at full blast. The TV channel selection was very basic, but had the local networks, the Weather Channel, TBS and ESPN. Free shampoo, conditioner and lotion. There was a wall safe too small for most laptops, an iron and ironing board, a hair drier, but no coffee maker.There were several very well-priced dining options and a 24-hour Dunkin Donuts. It was an easy walk to the entertainment of Fremont Street, or to catch the 108 city bus going to the Convention Center or the airport.You'd never call this place a luxury hotel, so I can't rate it 5 of 5. But it's adequate in every way and a great value. If you don't need a pool, the Fremont should work well for you.

Apr 14 2008 	Good risk!	Stayed at the Fremont Hotel April 11-13. Was initially worried because our booking was done at the last minute and this was the most reasonably-priced hotel we could find (we wondered whether there was somehting wrong with it). Well, the hotel was certainly good for the price!We had a late check-in and didn't encounter any problems. We got the two beds we requested and going to the room was a breeze - the elevator was right across from the registration desk (no long walks!) and our room was two doors down from the elevator. The room was certainly nice. It was clean and updated, and had an Asian touch - from the window shutters and the decor, to the carpet that had a bambo design. The bathroom wasn't as small as I had feared and I liked the fact that the towel rack wasn't above the toilet as where most hotels disgustingly place theirs.We had good meals at The Paradise Buffet. Even for breakfast, the items were heavy and the selection was good. The price was $10.99, however, and not $6+, as we were there on a weekend. The hotel has a Dunkin Donuts branch, but If you want to purchase any food there, my advice woud be to get them ONLY in the morning when they're fresh.For those unfamiliar with the Fremont Street Experience or the hotel area, the hotel's official address is on Fremont St. but drivers can't use that road to locate the hotel. From south Las Vegas Blvd, go past Fremont St. and make a left on the next block (Ogden St.) and make another left after 3rd St. and look for the building's parking entrance on the left. The hotel has no self-parking option (valet-only but free), so be prepared for extensive tipping if you decide to keep using your vehicle for city trips.

Apr 8 2008	Awesome Stay	We just completed our stay at the Fremont Hotel & Casino and had a great time. The staff there was wonderful and went out of there way to assist us (we even had the Slot Floor Supervisor, Pam Carrollo search for my husband because she had accidentally done something wrong on his players card and wanted to correct it). Even the housekeeper on our floor was fun. Every morning when we left our room (still feeling the effects from the night before) she would greet us with a big smile and a huge "GOOD MORNING", which made it a little easier to start our next day. The buffet was great and the casino offers exclusive table games which we found to be a blast. The room was a little small, but had everything we needed for our stay (including a view of Fremont Street). Can't wait to go back!!! Well worth the price!!!

Mar 27 2008 	More than Excellent!!!!	WOW!!!! We got a real cheap price using Kayak.com... Not expecting much, esp. from an older hotel/ casino, were we treated like royalty. Upon arrival, our vehicle was valet parked. At the desk, we were upgraded, w/o asking to a suite. Our accomodations were impeccable. We enjoyed our suite, the restaurant (an excellent buffet), and some gambling. Not once did we feel pressure to drink, gamble or partake in anything we did not feel comfortable doing. We felt absolutely at home and enjoyed everything offered. Would we stay there again? In a heartbeat! I am physically disabled and EVERYTHING was accessible.

Mar 22 2008 	What a bargain!	We stayed 2 nights at the Fremont, March 16 and 17, 2008. We received a mailer based on past play, one night $29, one night free. You can't beat that, not during March Madness and St. Patrick's day.Upon arrival we found the check in and lobby area newly remodeled since our last visit of July 2007. It looked fresh and organized, friendly staff had us in our room on the 7th floor within minutes. We had a double room, non smoking, very clean, but small. That was OK with us as we are not ones to spread stuff out all over the place. The TV was old, but no worse than mine in the kitchen at home, LOL! It had the weather channel which is all we needed. The bedding was all white, very nice no stains, etc. I read another post where someone complained about the beds. We did not find them uncomfortable, in fact we slept like babies until the sun peeked thru the shutters about 10 am. In room safes are a nice plus too.The casino was fun; we found lots of slots that we enjoy playing.If we receive another offer for our July trip, we will be back.

Mar 18 2008 	Terrible Experience	I travel to Vegas every two weeks and stay on Fremont quite often. The room was small and the TV outdated,especially compared to the 4 Queens just across the street. No inroom internet access and no room service made this feel like a 1950's trip. I caught a stomach virus and when requested late checkout I was told no twice. Finally a manager gave me 5pm,as my fever was over 100,but charged my 66$ for a few extra hours. If I had to stay here again, I would not go back to Vegas. It was that bad. The Manager at the front desk was far from professional,and should not be in her position. Stay elsewhere.

Mar 15 2008 	Great Value Great Location Rooms are brand new Employees very nice	Stayed at the Fremont Feb 20-23, 2008. The room was newly remodled and very clean. Like everyone else says, the bathroom is small, but manageable. Only complaint about the room was the drain didnt drain well in the tub. My Wife and I loved the hotel and casino, everyone was very nice, and had great drink service. The Fremont is also right in the middle of the Fremont Experience, so you can walk everywhere without losing your breath (like on the strip). The valet parking is free and fast (make sure you throw them a buck or two when they give you your car), and it is easy to get to from the airport. We ate at the Tony Romas for dinner, for the $11 steak and lobster, which was great and couldnt beleive they dont charge more for it! We ate at the buffet once for breakfast, they have a big selection and cheap prices. We would defenitely stay there again. It was only $45/nt for the weeknights, and $110 for the friday we were there. Again, highly recommended!

Mar 3 2008 	Nice stay	We only stayed one night here, but we were very happy with the property. The front desk staff were all very friendly and checked us in very quickly. The room was nice. The bed was fairly comfortable, but the bathroom was a little small. That, to us wasn't a big deal. I was very happy with the room itself. No major complaints. We ate at the buffet for breakfast and it was wonderful. I would stay there again any time.

Mar 2 2008 	Friendly environment	The Hotel must have been recently renovated. The bedroom they gave us was on the 7th floor. Fremont St was visible, however, the music was minimal. Also we had a great view of the surrounding mountains. It was a nicely decorated bedroom and had ample space. The bathroom, however, was on the small side. We were greeted by the friendliest staff at check-in. Most of the patrons were elderly (My GF and I are in our 20s) but it was suprisingly fun considering most people were helpful with the games we were playing. I would def stay here again. Just to experience Old Las Vegas far from the modern glitz. It was convenient to the Fremont St experience and other establishments. And the price was great.

Feb 27 2008 	Nice hotel but I wouldn't stay there again	My husband and I stayed at the Fremont for several days for our anniversary. We prefer the charm and ease of downtown to the glitz and glamour of the strip. I had heard that the Fremont had been remodeled, which is primarily the reason I wanted to stay there. Upon entering the hotel room, I was pleased with the decor. The furniture is new and the bedding and textiles are very modern and appealing, although the chair (and there is only one) was somewhat dirty. The bathrooms are very small, only allowing room enough for one person to be in there at the time, but that wasn't a problem for us. The bathtub was nice and spacious, so that was a plus. The real problems began at night when it was time to sleep. The bed was as hard as a rock. You would think with the money the hotel spent to upgrade the rooms, that they could have also splurged and upgraded the old matresses, but that didn't appear to be the case. Not only was the bed terribly uncomfortable, but the pillows were as well. The bedding was not user friendly at all, as the bedding consisted of a white flat sheet, covered with a cheap mock feather down blanket, topped with another white flat sheet. It may sound silly, but it was hard to keep the bedding straight with the 2 white sheets and white blanket. I am normally a person who sleeps in but I was up at 6:00am that first morning and couldn't wait to get out of the bed. My husband and I both had said we woke up every half hour of the night in discomfort. The next night was slightly easier since we knew what to expect, but again, I woke up stiff and in pain.I know people say they don't need a comfortable bed in Vegas because you don't really sleep much, but trust me, you do! Aside from the uncomfortable bed, small bathroom and lack of usable furniture, the hotel was nice. We ate at the Paradise Buffet twice for breakfast and although the service wasn't great, you can't beat an all you can eat breakfast for 6 bucks! The hotel employees seemed nice, although my interraction with them was brief upon checking in. If you want a tasefully decorated room in a fun Casino and don't mind cramped quarters and a board-like bed, then the Fremont is for you. But being a person who values sleep and comfort, I won't stay here again.

Feb 21 2008 	Great place to stay eat 	I stay at the Fremont 3-4 times a year. Just recently had to stay at Ballys (because of business) and I would have rather stayed at this favorite. The rooms have been remodeled, the buffet is one of the best in downtown. They even have a Zagat-rated restaurant with a phenomental T-bone steak dinner deal. It's conveniently located where I can walk to the Walgreens, movie theaters, other hotel casinos (try the Main St Hotel buffet...), and I can walk one block to the bus station and go to the strip for $2.In the past year, I've stayed at the Venetian, Treasure Island, Ballys and the LV Hilton. The small-town atmosphere of this hotel and casino keeps me coming back. Where else can you find $5 blackjack/craps tables, friendly dealers, waitresses and hosts? I'm a $5-10 BJ player and I get full room comps. The strip hotels don't even want to see your players card unless you're playing at $25 a hand. They've got a lot of the new slots, but if your luck turns bad or want a different machine, the other downtown casinos are literally 20 steps away.I hope that not too many will read this review, because if this little secret gets out, it will make it harder for me to get a room there when I'm in town.
Feb 10 2008 	Good location great casino	The room was average, but the staff was friendly and the casino was great. We would stay here again.

Feb 10 2008 	Nice hotel and casino- Great Value!!	Okay okay, I know the Golden Nugget is the "best" place to stay downtown. But with the prices they were charging, I decided to go with the Fremont for about half. Well let me say that we came here from two nights at the Flamingo and this was a welcome change! The whole property has recently been redone. Everything is kind of retro-modern in the decor. The rooms were in very nice shape and the casino and lobby areas were clean, fresh, and nicely decorated. I was really impressed.We checked in early, they had a room for us immediately. Do not be expecting any 'views' from the hotel, but we could see Binion's out our window and part of the Fremont Street Experience. The windows opened, too which was very useful. The room is on the small side, but plenty for two people. Bathroom is admittedly cramped, but functional. The food at the Buffet is above average in my opinion, and for the price it has real value. Dinner was $28 for me and my hubby. They had made to order steaks, a carving station, wide selection of seafood and fish, desserts, etc. We ate here twice. The Lenai Express place had some Asian dishes and quickie type food. We also ate at Tony Roma's, again great, and between 4:30 and 7:30 they have a full prime rib dinner for $8! Very good and again great value. Oh and don't miss the $1 margarita's at the casino bar!Downtown Vegas itself has pros and cons. The police are out everywhere, so as long as you stick to the main "drag" you will be safe. That being said, there are more "undesirables" hanging around the casinos than on the strip. I am not a prejudiced or snobby person, but you can tell when a homeless guy gets a buck and comes and sits next to you at a slot. But again, security in the casinos was great, and a once I saw a pit boss ask a guy to leave cause he was sleeping at the blackjack table. Considering the price and the actual size of the property, I was really happy with our stay here. The casino was larger than I thought it would be and even larger than some of the neighboring hotels (Las Vegas Club, 4 Queens). Comparing the Fremont to the other hotels nearby, I am glad I decided to stay here. Everything was new, fresh, service was great and I took some money home! Will stay here again if we decide to visit Downtown Vegas on our next trip.

Feb 3 2008 	good experience at the Fremont	stayed at the Fremont the last time in vegas. We have always loved the downtown area- it has the feel of living in a small town very close to a huge city. The fremont was clean & the rooms are very small but functional. There are tub/shower combos in the rooms. We got a very good deal on the room (like $32 a night). Ate at the Second Street Grill- the steaks were very good & the setting was dark & romantic. The cost was under $100 for meal, a drink & spilt a dessert. Also, ate breakfast at the buffet- it was decent for a regular breakfast.The Fremont even took care of us when our flight was cancelled & we had to stay an extra night.

Jan 31 2008 	Great "Mid Canopy" Downtown Hotel 	This was my first stay at the Fremont. I like the 4 Queens but I like trying a different hotel each trip which is why I normally split my stays between at least 2 hotels. I found a great rate over MLK weekend, Friday and Saturday at $40 per night. Arrived very late in the evening and check-in was a breeze and the registration clerk was very helpful and friendly. Lobby looks to be newly renovated. Room was just a little on the small side but how much room can one person take up! Room was very clean, nicely furnished and the heat/ac worked just fine. Boyd needs to add a coffee maker to the rooms though. I hate trecking through a casino for a cup of coffee. The hallways were very quiet which made for some good sleeping. I didn't eat at any of the restaurants so I can't comment on that. Their cocktail/drink service could be a lot better, few and far between. Overall, I liked the Fremont and would definately stay there again. Downtown is so much fun!

Jan 28 2008 	Great Value for the $$	I had a non-smoking room with a king bed. The room seemed to be recently renovated and the furnishings were reminiscent of those boutique hotels that are cropping up in the big cities. I was very impressed with the bed linens, none of those ubiquitous polyester bedcovers (see picture). The bed was firm but not hard. The room was small (but not European small) with enough room for two people. The bathroom counter and sink was below standard U.S. heights. I'm 5 foot 4 inches and I felt like a giant in there. The towels were neither threadbare nor fluffy and they did the job they were designed do. My room overlooked the Fremont Street Experience and I could hear a constant hum/thrum in the room at nights. The television small with limited free stations. I would like to have a better selection of channels. An mini-refigerator and a cofee maker would also have been nice. The only area in the room that didn't seem updated was where the luggage, clothes hangers and iron/ironing board were stored (see picture). There was also a "safebox" that locked with a key. It was pretty flimsy by way of a safe, but at least you could lock up any valuables.I had breakfast and dinner at the Paradise Buffet which served mediocre to average fare. I feel I got a good value for the price paid -- better ambience compared to a similarly priced (overpriced) property like Best Western, Ramada Inn, Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn and others of that calibre.

Jan 17 2008 	Handy to Everything!!	Stayed at the Fremont Jan.5-9, 2008. We arrived by 11am and the front desk had our room ready. We have stayed on the strip and usually at the Golden Nugget but decided to try the Fremont. What a great choice me made. All personel were very friendly and willing to help from the front desk, house cleaning to the bell hop. Such a great location as you can be on Fremont Steet in seconds. We ate at the Paradise buffet for breakfast and dinner and found it to be a wonderful bargin. A Sams Town shuttle bus stops at the side door, by schedule all day long. Great fun to go there as Sams even has a movie theater which we went to - got us away from the machines. Yes, the room are small but the bed is great. We kept the widow open all day for fresh air and never needed any heat. If you want a nice, clean room at an easy to get around place then this is for you!! We would stay there again, no question. If you want big and fancy do yourself a favor and don't stay here, you will be unhappy!!

Jan 13 2008 	A Perfect Fit	I just spent six days at The Fremont and was delighted that there is still a truly friendly place left in Las Vegas. Every employee I had contact with was kind, helpful and eager to meet my needs. This was everyone from management to custodian. As the owner of a lodging establishment I can only tell you that this seems to be almost impossible to achieve.Rooms are newly updated and well kept plus very quiet. The bathroom may be a bit small for some but served me just fine.Housekeeping staff could not do more to make sure my needs were met, they asked me, not the other way around.Had my best meal in Las Vegas at The Second Street Grill inside The Fremont. Please do yourself a big favor and order the Sizzling Spinach Salad, a meal onto itself.My first time to stay downtown in "Glitter Gulch" on the Fremont Experience. I will not return to The Strip again. Great security and well maintained area, no people pushing all the nudey cards at you that just litter the strip. Plus it is very easy to get around, public transportation readily available, or easy freeway access just blocks away.

Jan 13 2008	Disgusting--Don't set foot in the place	This joint is so old it is disgusting, dirty and things are falling apart, not to mention the ventilation system. The rooms are very small and musty smelling. The right hand/cold water faucet on our sink broke off and the shower/tub was filthy...you turned on the water and the bottom became dangerously slippery. Then, we tried to turn on the 60's thermostat and once the fan came on, my husband went into a violent coughing attack because so much dust blew out of the vents and into the room.This place needs to be imploded NOW.

Jan 6 2008 	Our favorite hotel/casino in Vegas!	Let me start out by stating that we prefer Downtown to any other area of Vegas. While not as glitzy or ritzy, it has a more authentic, old-school feeling than the Disnyfied Strip that is more geared to adults than to families. That being said, the accomodations are generally not as luxurious as those found on the Strip, but there are several clean and comfortable hotels to choose from. But, who goes to Vegas to hang out in their hotel room anyway?We have stayed/played at the Fremont many times and always have a great time! We usually receive comps to stay there for free, but even if we don't have comps, it is our first choice of places to stay/play downtown. When we were planning our wedding (7/7/07 - an incredibly busy time in Vegas), I called the Fremont because they were sold out and we had no offers for that weekend. We were willing to pay for a room to stay there (over all other downtown hotels which had availability). When I told them that we had become engaged in their casino during our previous stay and that we were returning to Vegas to get married and would rather pay full rate to stay at the Fremont instead of any other hotel (many which had availability), they not only made room for us, but they comped our stay! This is indicative of the level of customer service and the generally warmer, more intimate atmosphere at the Fremont that keeps us coming back for more.The hotel was recently renovated and the rooms, while not expansive, are tasteful, clean, and cozy. We are always quite comfortable there. The check-in is quick and easy, and we always find the staff to be very accomodating.We always have a great time in the casino and rarely venture out to play elsewhere. The cocktail service is generally reliable, and the cocktail waitresses are friendly (Remember to tip your server! These ladies work hard!). Sometimes we win...sometimes we don't; however, we generally feel like we get decent play for our money (as opposed to some casinos that seem to suck the money out of our wallets).We have eaten weekend brunch there many times (champagne brunch on Saturdays and Sundays). While the selection is not overwhealming (as in some of the strip buffets) they hit the right notes. There is a carving station, omlette bar, cold seafood selection, salad bar, the usual breakfast selections, and some other various hot/cold foods. The food always hits the spot, and the servers aren't stingy with the champagne. Plus the price can't be beat!We've also dined at the Second Street Grill (the upscale restaurant in the center of the casino). This is one of the better restaurants in the downtown area. The menu leans toward "pacific rim" but also offers steaks and other more "traditional" dishes. The food is delicious and high-quality, the presentation is beautiful, and the room is warm and intimate. We have stayed at almost all the other hotels downtown (including the Golden Nugget [the most upscale hotel, but we found it to be large and impersonal and a bit snooty and wannabe strip-like], the Plaza [mixed experiences - it's been a while, but it felt a bit gritty back in the day], Vegas Club [OK rooms but lacks personality], Golden Gate [really quaint and cozy in a bygone ere kind of way and great shrimp cocktails], Four Queens [again, nice rooms but slightly impersonal], Binions [not the same since it lost the "Horseshoe", the Benny's Natural breakfast special and the million dollar display], the Fitz [OK but generic], and Lady Luck [before it closed]) but our first choice for playing and staying downtown is easily the Fremont!

Dec 24 2007 	Nice place for the money	We stayed at the Fremont Hotel for two nights, 12/19 and 12/20. Upon entering the room we noticed that it was on the smaller side. However, it looked as though it had totally been redone recently. The room was updated and looked very nice. The bathroom was also very small, but also looked as if had recently been updated. The room was very clean and comfortable. We slept well on the bed and the room was quiet. Although we didn't have the greatest view, we got what we asked for, a king bed in a non smoking room. For the short amount of time we spent in the room, the view didn't matter. Everybody from the check in staff, to the valet to the cleaning staff were all very pleasent and nice. We have stayed on the strip many times, but looked to save a few bucks on the room for extra gambling money by staying downtown. We are glad that we did, and would stay at the Fremont again. It is not a mega resort with glitsy shows and sights, but is more than sufficient if you want a clean cheaper priced room to sleep in down town. Give it a shot if you plan on trying a stay downtown. The casino was also decent, however there is no poker room. We enjoyed the dowtown atmosphere for gambling, and took a drive to the strip to see a show, but returned downtown for a cheaper gamble. We will be back to the Fremont.

Nov 11 2007 	Excellent stay at the Fremont	I took a solo trip to LV and stayed at the Fremont for three comped nights from November 6-9. I was in Room 418 near the elevator. The room is not large, and the bathroom is small, but I consider the Fremont to be an excellent value Downtown. The housekeeping is very good with helpful and friendly staff. I look forward to my next stay at the Fremont.

Oct 12 2007 	Great value Downtown	Having stayed at the Golden Nugget last time we stayed Downtown, we though we'd try out the Fremont and I have to stay it was excellent value for money. Ok - so the casino is a bit dowdy but the check-in was effortless and the room itself clean and comfortable. The bathroom size was smallish but everything functioned satisfactorily. Considering the price we paid, we could not have hoped for better.We would happily recommend the hotel to anyone staying downtown.

Sep 14 2007	had a great time	I received my stay as a free comp in the mail. Was surprised to receive a 5 day 4 nite stay. But I took them up on it and am very glad I did. The room was small, but very clean, anyway thats all anyone needs. Only used it to clean up and sleep. Nice comfortable bed and pillows and new furnishings. It was always made up and cleaned early every day. We got there early and was able to check in right away which was great. The buffet was excellent. I enjoyed staying on Fremont street, much better than the strip. Its like a big party every nite. So much to see, without all the walking. Thank you Fremont for the invite. I hope to return.

Sep 5 2007 	Geat location. Great price	This hotel was provided for in a package deal from Vacations Hawaii so the price was a excellent. The room was clean and the staff members were friendly though the hotel's parking only allows for valet parking. Jul 31 2007 	A Decent Bargain Hotel	I had a room at the Flamingo booked for July 22-25 (Sun --Wed) for a great rate of $60/night. However, most of the hotels on the strip (and many off of the strip) were running $120-$250 for Saturday, July 21. I was traveling with my wife and we both realized that this was waaaay too much to pay for a room when that we would spend so little time in. My first thought was the Orleans, but their rooms were running around $120/night for a Saturday stay. With this in mind, I checked around and found a $60/night rate at the Fremont. We had never stayed downtown before but figured we would give it a try....As others have stated, the room itself was clean and VERY small. Some of the furniture looked updated, but gernally speaking, the room itself was VERY old and dated looking (same for the hallways and common areas). The a/c worked ok but not great and the T.V. got very few channles. However, none of this was very important because after a long day of traveling all we did was fall asleep anyway.In summary, If you're looking for BASIC accomodations at a bargain price in downtown Vegas I think the Fremont fits the bill without a problem. I think if I find myself in the same siutation again I will try the El Cortez or head out to a "local" spot like Sam's Town for the one night stay.

Jul 31 2007	Fremont Hotel	Stayed at the "Fremont for the second time. Not a negative thing to say. Hotel staff very accomadating. We asked for a king non smoking room. It was small but very nice. Comfortable bed and nice linens. We were asked what part of the hotel we would like. I asked for a room away from the Fremont exxperience where it would be quiet. That was not a problem. Never heard any noise. The room attendent was very good. We have no problem with the Fremont and would stay there again. Love downtown. It is very fun and cozy. The strip is fun for us to visit, but not to swtay there.

Jul 28 2007 	The All NEW Fremont!	OK, I got to admit, I like dirty, dingy, downtown Vegas. I like to play awhile at one place and then move on to the next place, all without breaking a sweat!I have stayed in lots of Vegas hotels and when I stay and play downtown, I end up at either the Fremont or the Golden Nugget. This last visit we stayed at a comped room at the newly renovated Fremont. No, the casino, lobby and main areas are all the same, but the rooms have all been tastefully redone and they are very, very nice.Subtle tones, new bedding, and a shower curtain rod that keeps the curtain from flying all over the place during a shower.Sure the Fremont isn't the Wynn, nor does it try to be. The rooms are tiny and old Vegas. Back in the day players weren't expected to stay in their rooms, they were expected to be on the casino floor, so the old rooms are small. But hey, they are really clean, nicely redecorated, comfortable and cheap.If you want the big mega tourist resorts, stick to the Strip. But if you want that old Vegas feeling, check out the newly renovated Fremont.

Jul 8 2007	Loved the Fremond	This was the best hotel I've ever stayed in Las Vegas! Never had stayed downtown and I will only stay at the Fremont when I return to Vegas! The location was excellent and the room was exceptionally clean! The blinds were a great alternative to curtains!! The room was quiet and just perfect!!!! I can't wait to stay there again!! Taxis were easy to find to get to go the strip! The food choices were so much better downtown and the prices were so reasonable! Also, the security was very visable not only in the hotel but the entire downtown area!! Highly recommend the Fremont!! My new home in Las Vegas!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Jun 23 2007 	Great For One Person	I found the room to be small, but comfortable and very clean. The remodeled room is soothing and quiet. Nice textures. I was one person in the room, and just right for me, with a king-size bed, chair and ottoman. I think it would be fine for a couple that doesn't need to spread out. In my opinion, it would be too smallfor people needing two double beds.The bathroom is very small. Think "cruise ship with a tub". Again, perfectly fine for me as a solo. Or anyone who just wants the basics and no need to spread out.Dining is not an issue. Nice buffet, coffee shop, Tony Roma, and plenty of other dining options just steps away at the other casinos.The only thing I'd like to change in the room is to have the air conditioner blow out into the room, not just up to the ceiling in front of the window. But, as long as I left the air on low cool all day, it was comfortable when coming back to the room.

Jun 3 2007 	Great place to stay	This hotel was great. The valet and registration attendants were very friendly. The rooms were all redone a year ago and were very nice. Nice comfy bed, nice bathroom, etc. Really enjoyed staying here in the downtown atmosphere. They also share a pool with the California hotel across the street-very easy to get to and easy to use. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

May 23 2007 	not as bad as I expected	I ended up staying here one night on a business trip because all the other hotels were booked or way too expensive. It was $80 and based on the reviews here I thought it couldn't be too bad. The valet parking, hotel registration, and elevators were very conveniently located. They upgraded me to a suite, which was unfortunately right next to the elevators. The suite was small but quaintly furnished, very cute. You can tell the rooms are old, the bathroom is tiny, but they have tried to update it with modern decor. No room service, so I had to eat at the cafe. I had the Singapore Noodles, very good. For some reason the restaurant was not open at 6:45 when I came down for breakfast so I went across the street to the Starbucks at the Golden Nugget.

May 8 2007 	4th time we've stayed!	We come to LasVegas at least twice a year. The past 2 years we have stayed at the Fremont! Nothing fancy but, everything we need. The staff is very friendly & helpful. We ALWAYS do better at the slots atthe Fremont than we have ever done anywhere else! The buffett was good & Had good service at the steak house! We love the atmosphere at "Fremont Street" - layed back & comfortable!! We take the shuttle to the Strip a couple of days & enjoy that also but, Really Love Fremont Street!! It's an experience!! Can't wait to come back and stay in November!!

Apr 15 2007 	Good Deal at Fremont	Stayed a the Fremont April 10-13, 2007. No charge for room under the April Slot Marathon promotion recieved in the mail. We have gambled at the Fremont before, but this was our first stay. No complaints, great at the price!Quick and easy check in at 2:00 PM on Tuesday afternoon. No self parking, valet only, but quick service, never waited more than a couple minutes for the car. Room 1127 was a few doors down from the elevator. Yes, the rooms are small, but they are nicely decorated, and are well appointed. Comfortable bed, no charge wall safe, hair dryer, ironing board and iron. King size bed was very comfortable, and the pillows very soft, we each needed two each, provided very cheerfully by the maid. The TV has only a few channels, but they are the most needed by a traveler, TWC and CNN and the local channels. Who needs a TV in Vegas other than to check the weather? The AC/heater worked fine, and was just loud enough to screen any incidentalnoise from the hall.The bathroom is also small, one person at a time, but everything is clean and functional. Good water pressure, and the shower head was plenty high enough for me (5'10").The decor in the rooms has a retro 50's feel. Especially the carpet. But it works and looks great! Everything was clean and fuctional. Thestaff was pleasant and helpful. We would definitly stay at the Fremont again. It's not the Bellagio, but is a great value for a stay downtown.p_jay2001

Apr 3 2007 	Clean Cheap but not Glamorous!!!!	This was my first trip to Las Vegas and my friend and I stayed for two nights at the Fremont. The hotel was what I was looking for - inexpensive. Overall, the rooms were pretty clean and I liked the recent renovation. HOWEVER, if you are looking for an exciting casino/hotel with good amenities I would definitely NOT recommend staying at the Fremont. I wish the room would have been brighter. I was also disappointed by the lack of channels on cable for when I woke up with a hangover :)I would recommend this place if you are looking for a cheap stay downtown. I would recommend Paris Las Vegas if you're looking to spend a little extra to stay in a posh place with young people aroundyou.

Mar 25 2007 	Nice hotel for the price	This hotel reminds me of an upgraded Days Inn. We had room 1007. Very clean. Two double beds. We arrived at 11:30 pm and there were people still at the front desk. Very quick check in. Bathroom was tiny. Two people can't stand in there comfortably at the same time. Shower was very good, great water pressure.Sheets were clean. They have a sign in the bathroom that if you take the towels, pillows, or washcloths you will be billed a fee that ranges from $10 - $40. I think they were serious. LOL. The pillows are down and very soft, so I can see where someone might want to steal them. Requests for extra pillows, towels, etc was met with cheerful politeness. Everyone was so darn nice!! It was refreshing. We didn't eat at any of the hotels restaurants but I did get a snack at the Lanai express at 4am. I had the best burger and fries. Between the hours of 12am to 7am they serve a limited menu of breakfast and burgers etc. Great for when you finally look at your watch and realize you missed all of the regular restaurants.Overall a great stay. If you get a players card they will probably hit your email up for offers.
